question: 大会
sourceMnemonic: When you have a <kanji>big</kanji> <kanji>meet</kanji> there's a lot of people together. Why would you have a bunch of people gather together? Probably for a <vocabulary>convention</vocabulary> or some kind of <vocabulary>tournament</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>event</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>大</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

Did you know that Japan has entire <vocabulary>convention</vocabulary>s on <reading>tie</reading> <reading>kay</reading>aking (<ja>たいかい</ja>)? They regularly hold <vocabulary>tournament</vocabulary>s where they go kayaking using nothing but ties! Sounds pretty exhausting...
